intro: Jacobinia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican Jacobinia, is a small evergreen shrub native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white flowers with a faintly fragrant scent. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Jacobinia mexicana is well-suited for xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
